definition: variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: The reporter wants to heckle the candidate with those embarrassing question.
sentences.chinese: 记者想用那些让人难为情的问题来刁难这位候选人。

sentences.english: Aim low, and don't be embarrassed to make these really, really easy jobs.
sentences.chinese: 目标要低，不要因为这些任务太容易而难为情。

sentences.english: It's really embarrassing when he acts up in public.
sentences.chinese: 他在外头耍脾气，真令我难为情。

sentences.english: Come on, Mary. Don't be backward.
The obviousness of the lie was embarrassing.
sentences.chinese: 那是明摆著的谎话，真叫人难为情。

sentences.english: When he started undressing in public I didn't know where to look.
sentences.chinese: 他在大庭广众之下脱衣服，我感到很难为情。

sentences.english: The student felt very shy as he stood in front of the class.
sentences.chinese: 那个学生站在大家的跟前时，感到非常难为情。

sentences.english: I felt embarrassed about how untidy the house was.
sentences.chinese: 这房子太不整洁了，我对此感到很难为情。

sentences.english: It humiliates me to think that I am of the same age as that baldy .
sentences.chinese: 想到我和这孱头同年纪，我便感到难为情。

sentences.english: Don't be afraid or ashamed to do things solo.
sentences.chinese: 不要害怕或为单独做事情感到难为情。

sentences.english: The reporter wanted to heckle the candidate with those embarrassing questions.
sentences.chinese: 记者想用那些让人难为情的问题来刁难这位候选人。

sentences.english: There is nothing to be ashamed of.
She was still self-conscious8 about her voice, though, and she never sang a note9.
sentences.chinese: 她对自己的嗓音仍旧感到难为情，从未哼过一个音符。

sentences.english: Was it merely to ride to Longbourn and be embarrassed?
sentences.chinese: 难道就是为了骑着马到浪搏恩来难为情一番吗？

sentences.english: I assure you that I have long been most heartily ashamed of it.
sentences.chinese: 告诉你，我自己也早已为那件事觉得难为情。

sentences.english: A woman results in the elevator in the hospital the childbirth, thinks extremely embarrassedly .
sentences.chinese: 一个女人在医院得升降机中分娩，觉得非常难为情。

definition: to feel embarrassed/to find it embarrassing/to be sorry (for inconveniencing sb)
affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
to blush/to redden (with shame, indignation etc)
lacking in confidence/diffident/to have a guilty conscience
ashamed and unable to show one's face
